txt.en: This is a good place to <rgb=#FF0000>listen</rgb> to the sounds of Máttugard

'[placeholder], it is hard to believe but my eyes do not deceive me. The throne of Zidir-nesad has been restored. Let us admire our work.\n\n'Yes, I say ours, for this was as much your doing as it was my own!'
The Throne of Zidir-nesad can be found at the Steepset in Máttugard.\n\nYou should return to the Throne of Zidir-nesad.
Prince Ingór can be found at Vérnozal in Máttugard.\n\nYou should talk to Prince Ingór.
'What is this?!'
The Throne of Zidir-nesad can be found at the Steepset in Máttugard.\n\nYou should examine the fully restored throne.
'Oh, I am just testing it out.'
Prince Ingór can be found at the Steepset in Máttugard.\n\nYou should talk to Prince Ingór.
Rísti Graver can be found at the Steepset in Máttugard.\n\nYou should talk to Rísti Graver.
The Steepset can be found in Máttugard.\n\nYou should <rgb=#FF0000>look</rgb> out over Máttugard at Steepset.
Talk to Prince Ingór upon the throne at Steepset
This is not a good place to <rgb=#FF0000>look</rgb> out over Máttugard
The Steepset can be found in Máttugard.\n\nYou should <rgb=#FF0000>listen</rgb> to the sounds of Máttugard at the Steepset.
Talk to Rísti Graver
Examine the fully restored throne
Zidir-nesad, the seat of Gundabad's lord, has been restored.
'It has been a pleasure working with you. I am sure there is more work in Gundabad for me, and for you as well!\n\n'May our paths cross again, friend [placeholder]. Take care of yourself.'
Talk to Prince Ingór at Vérnozal
Return to the throne of Zidir-nesad
<rgb=#FF0000>Look</rgb> out over Máttugard at the Steepset
This is not a good place to <rgb=#FF0000>listen</rgb> to the sounds of Máttugard
Rísti Graver can be found at the Steepset in Máttugard.\n\nYou should talk to Rísti Graver.

'It is as the text described, a simple and beautiful throne, illuminated by power and compassion.\n\n'We should send word to Prince Ingór. He has done much to keep safe the throne and the halls near the Steepset. He will be pleased to gaze upon the throne restored.'
This is a good place to <rgb=#FF0000>look</rgb> out over Máttugard

'Oh, I am just testing it out. This is not my throne to claim... yet. Fine craftsmanship! You and Rísti Graver have done well! I and all the Zhélruka give you our respect and thanks on this day.\n\n'Hmm, do you hear that? Do you see that? Listen well to Máttugard, and truly look out from the heights. Something has changed.'
The throne has been restored, as impressive as when it was newly-made
You begin to see a home for the Zhélruka, for all dwarves, in this Mighty Court
'What is this? You say the throne of Zidir-nesad has been restored? This is a momentous day indeed! I shall depart for the throne immediately. Meet me there, [placeholder].'
You hear not the sound of conflict, but the sound of lives being lived
Talk to Rísti Graver
When you arrive, Prince Ingór sits confidently upon the throne
<rgb=#FF0000>Listen</rgb> to the sounds of Máttugard at the Steepset
Zidir-nesad: Epilogue
